question: Which three countries share the location of "Mount Uwaynat"?
explanation: Egypt, Libya and Sudan share the location of Mount Uwaynat. Mount Uwaynat, also known as Gabal El Uweinat, is a 1934 metres high mountain range located in the Egyptian-Libya-Sudanese tri-point. This mountain is notable for its prehistoric petroglyphs which are engraved in sandstone and petroglyphs of Bushmen style are visible, representing lions, giraffes, ostriches, gazelles, cows and little human figures.
